title: Jugendstil type
content:
Looking for some Jugendstil type like this [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image:Jugend-Kley.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202185046/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image:Jugend-Kley.jpg "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image:Jugend-Kley.jpg") or something similar with serifs.

 [‹ Do u Know a good Design/Art school???](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202185046/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36477 "Go to previous forum topic") [Sporty Script Font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202185046/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36486 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kattttor

comments.content:
Here is your query in German (helps a lot when googling):  
 [http://images.google.com/images?client=safari&rls=en&q=Jugendstil+schrif...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202185046/http:/images.google.com/images?client=safari&rls=en&q=Jugendstil+schrift&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8&um=1&sa=N&tab=wi "http://images.google.com/images?client=safari&rls=en&q=Jugendstil+schrift&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8&um=1&sa=N&tab=wi")

I just had a look again at the picture in your link. It’s not Jugendstil, it’s much closer to Art Deco which was the later movement popularizing the modernist movement. You should look for (proto) Art Deco type with a teutonic flair instead.
Judging by your link, you should try some fonts by Richard Lipton, like Bremen or Munich — they’re not Inline, but they come pretty close.

rss

With a little luck you might find something at

[http://www.moorstation.org/typoasis/typoasis1.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202185046/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/typoasis1.htm "http://www.moorstation.org/typoasis/typoasis1.htm")

Most of the offerings are by the very prolific members of the free font movement and many are historical renditions from one period or another.

Gerald
